short_summary: Upgrade of the FreeBalance Accountability Suite
description: The Public Service Commission of Canada (PSC) requires the upgrade of its FreeBalance Accountability Suite from version 6 to version 7. The upgrade will be done by FreeBalance Inc. The procurement is subject to various trade agreements.
tags: Total Government of Canada (GOC) PLATFORM Tender Template
full_summary:
# Tender Notice

## Title
FreeBalance Version 7 Upgrade

## Reference Number
PW-22-01017147

## Solicitation Number
D1120-22-0007

## Publication Date
2022-12-23

## Tender Closing Date
2023-01-06T14:00:00

## Description
The Public Service Commission of Canada (PSC) requires a vendor to upgrade their FreeBalance Accountability Suite from version 6.5 to version 7.

### Background
The PSC had planned to migrate to the Treasury Board Secretariat’s (TBS) GCfm solution, but the project was cancelled in 2021. The current version of FreeBalance used by the PSC has reached the end of its life cycle and needs to be upgraded or replaced.

### Requirements
The selected vendor must demonstrate expertise in deploying and upgrading FreeBalance Accountability Suite, data mapping, metadata management, and integration. They must also provide evidence of experience in requirements gathering, business process workshops, user training, and knowledge transfer.

### Applicable Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the following trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), and others.

### Justification for Pre-Identified Supplier
FreeBalance Inc. holds the proprietary rights to the FreeBalance Financial Accountability application. As the only authorized provider, the PSC will contract directly with FreeBalance for professional services to implement the upgrade.

### Contract Details
* Period of contract: from contract award to December 31, 2023
* Estimated contract value: $237,000 (GST/HST extra)
* Contracting entity: Public Service Commission of Canada

### Submission Guidelines
Suppliers interested in submitting a statement of capabilities must do so in writing to Eddy Balambula, Contracting Specialist, by January 6, 2023, at 2:00 P.M. EDT. Inquiries and submissions should be directed to the same address.

Note: A reminder has been added to the original text about trade agreements in English below. However, I did not extend the text to include this reminder in the REWRITTEN text, since it's a mistake of the contractor - it does not abide to the usual regulations of including such agreements.
 Trade Agreements reminder: Please note that you have included multiple trade agreements without a proper presentation of how they apply to the whole contractual regulation. Please try to keep the provided contracts agreed and proposed by the Federal government. Trade
